result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Makeveli D Henderson

records.addlTxt:
9:41 AM Defendant Makeveli D Henderson in court.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Makeveli D Henderson. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense has discovery and an offer, requests a date in 60 days. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

8:24 AM Defendant Makeveli D Henderson in court.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Makeveli D Henderson.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Search Warrant Executed on 07-27-2022 - 3 Cell phones (City of Waukesha Police Department)
Preliminary hearing on August 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:27 AM Defendant Makeveli D Henderson in court with attorney Justis Griffis for attorney Cassandra A Miller.  Lesli S Boeseappeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Griffis states that attorney Miller is out with a medical issue and requests an adjournment.
The State does not object.
Preliminary time limits previously waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Cassie Miller has been appointed to represent the defendant.
Preliminary hearing on July 27, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.

03:39 PM Defendant Makeveli D Henderson in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:15 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
